oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anesthesiologists Learning to Use Videolaryngoscopes in Children
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Robinson, Joan
Lees, Mackenzie
Spady, Don
Seal, Robert
Csanyi-Fritz, Yvonne
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The primary purpose of this study was to establish the ability of pediatric anesthesiologists to learn to use two video laryngoscopes - the GlideScope system (GS) and the Karl Storz Direct Coupled Interface.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
surgical procedures
video laryngoscopes
intubation
anesthesiology
laryngoscopes
lung
pediatrics
tracheal intubation morbidity
